items.title: What's a trip?
items.text: A trip is a set of flights booked for 1 travel occasion, whether for business or leisure. It can include multiple stops and connecting flights along the way. Example: Paris → Rome → Madrid → Paris = 1 trip

items.title: When should I add a trip?
items.text: Make sure to add trips at least 48 hours before your scheduled departure. Your plan size determines the number of trips protected by your AirHelp+ benefits.

items.title: How long is my plan valid?
items.text: Your membership is valid for 12 months from purchase and includes disruption, luggage, and missed connection insurance for first {{count}} trips. Your other discounts and perks still apply all year round!

items.title: What's a trip?
items.text: A trip is a set of flights booked for 1 travel occasion, whether for business or leisure. It can include multiple stops and connecting flights along the way. Example: Miami → Dallas → Boston → Miami = 1 trip

accordions.title: Why should I provide this document?
accordions.text: Airlines require this document as proof that you were present on your flight.

accordions.title: How can I ensure it's accepted?
accordions.text: A boarding pass should have your name, flight info, and booking number on it, along with a scan code.

accordions.title: What if I received it digitally?
accordions.text: Download it as a PDF or screenshot it, then upload it as a document.

accordions.title: What if I have a printed document?
accordions.text: You can scan the document or take a picture of it with your mobile phone or camera.

boardingPassScreen.description: This digital or printed document allows you to board the flight.
boardingPassScreen.title: Boarding pass

accordions.title: Why should I provide this document?
accordions.text: Airlines require this document as proof that you were present on your flight.

accordions.title: How can I ensure it's accepted?
accordions.text: Make sure it contains your name, the airline name, all flights and dates, and the booking reference number (usually 5 or 6 characters) or e-ticket number.

accordions.title: How do I find it?
accordions.text: You can find it in your email inbox, the airline website, or on their app. It could also be in your mobile wallet.

bookingConfirmationScreen.description: This document proves you purchased a seat on the disrupted flight.

loungePass.title: You can use this pass only once

items.title: How do I get lounge access?
items.text: As an AirHelp+ member, you'll gain lounge access when your flight's delayed over 1 hour or canceled less than 6 hours before departure. The number of trips covered varies depending on the plan purchased.

items.title: Can I add my trip at any time to get a lounge pass when my flight is delayed or canceled?
items.text: Unfortunately, no. Your trip has to have been added to your AirHelp+ dashboard at least 48 hours before the scheduled departure time of your flight.

items.title: Can I use a lounge with a fellow passenger?
items.text: Lounge passes are personalised to your name so only apply to you. If fellow passengers have AirHelp+, they can access lounges with their own pass.

items.title: Can I use the pass more than once?
items.text: Passes are for 1 use only, so once you've entered a lounge, you've used your pass.

items.title: What happens if I don't use a pass?
items.text: You have 3 months to enjoy your pass at any airport in our directory. If you don't use it within 3 months, the pass expires and cannot be used.

items.title: Can I use a lounge that's not in the lounge finder?
items.text: No, sorry. You can only use the lounges that appear in our lounge finder.

successScreen.title: Welcome to AirHelp+

items.name: {{value}} when your flight's disrupted
items.detailsDescription:
It's easy. We track your flight, let you know when you're eligible, and then quickly pay you {{value}} if:
  • • Your flight’s delayed by 3+ hours on arrival
  • • Your flight’s canceled within 28 days of departure
  • • Your flight’s diverted
    • The best thing? That {{value}} payout is on top of any airline compensation you’re owed. No paperwork, no signature - just fast payouts straight to your bank account.

items.name: {{value}} when you miss a connecting flight
items.detailsHeader:
{{value}} when you miss a
connecting flight
items.detailsDescription:
When your first flight is delayed, canceled, or diverted, and you miss a connection, we’ll give you a fast {{value}} payout to help with the hassle.

Just send us your flight details, a proof of the delay, and your boarding passes, and your payout will be on the way.

Heads up: your flights must be part of the same booking to qualify for this insurance.

items.name: {{value}} when your luggage is lost or delayed
items.detailsHeader:
{{value}} when your luggage is
lost or delayed
items.detailsDescription:
It’s simple. If your luggage gets delayed or lost, we’ll pay you {{value}}.

Just grab a Property Irregularity Report (PIR) from the airport’s lost luggage desk and send us what we need. Then your {{value}} payout is on its way. And it’s on top of any compensation the airline might owe you, of course.

items.name: Lounge access during a disruption
items.detailsDescription:
If your flight’s delayed over 1 hour or canceled, you can relax in over {{value}}+ airport lounges worlwide.

Just add your flight details in the app. If your flight’s disrupted, we’ll send you a lounge pass.

Lounge access dependes on availability and opening hours. If you can’t use your lounge pass immediately, it remains valid for 3 months and can be used worldwide at any supported lounge.

items.name:
Up to {{value}} compensation from airline
<emphasized>No service fee taken!</emphasized>
items.detailsDescription: We’ll claim compensation from the airline on your behalf. You keep 100% – we don’t take a cut.

items.name: 24/7 dedicated support
items.detailsDescription: Receive reliable help around the clock from our team of more than 400 customer service professionals.

items.name: Travel discounts & benefits
items.detailsDescription: Get discounts on travel essentials like eSIMs for reliable global internet, car rentals, and other perks.

items.name:
Up to {{value}} airline cash compensation
<emphasized>No service fee taken!</emphasized>
items.detailsHeader: Up to {{value}} compensation from airline for EU and US-EU flights
items.detailsDescription: We’ll claim compensation from the airline on your behalf for flights within the EU or between the EU and the United States. You keep 100% – we don’t take a cut.

items.title: How do I invite friends to claim with AirHelp?
items.text: It's easy! As soon as you sign up, you'll receive your personalized link and QR code, which you can share with you friends via messages or social media.

items.title: How much do I get for sharing AirHelp with my friends?
items.text:
For every friend who successfully claims compensation using your link or QR code, you'll receive a {{value}} prepaid virtual gift card by email.
There may also be special promos where we increase the referral reward for a limited time.

items.title: How long is my link or QR code valid for?
items.text:
There's no expiration for your link and QR code. Share away!
You can find more information about the referral program in our <termsLink>Terms and Conditions<termsLink>.

items.title: How will I receive my reward if my friend files a claim?
items.text:
When your friend receives their compensation you will receive an email notifying you that your reward has been approved along with instructions on how to redeem your gift card. All rewards are paid out on a weekly basis.
Once your reward is approved, it may take up to 7 days for you to receive your gift card.

items.title: Is there a limit on the number of friends I can refer?
items.text:
You can receive rewards for up to 50 friends using your referral link or code.
If you want to share AirHelp with a larger audience, you should check out our Affiliate Program.

items.title: How do I redeem my reward?
items.text: You'll receive an email with instructions on how to redeem and use your prepaid virtual gift card, which can be used online anywhere where it's accepted.

items.title: How long is a reward valid for?
items.text: You have 30 days to activate your gift card from the day you receive it. Once activated, the card can be used immediately. The card validity varies depending on the card chosen, so be sure to check the provider's Terms and Conditions.

items.title: Why didn't I receive a reward even though my friend filed a claim?
items.text: If your friend's claim for compensation isn't eligible, you won't receive a reward. See our <termsLink>Terms and Conditions</termsLink> for more information.

items.title: What if my friend has submitted an accepted claim but I didn't receive a reward?
items.text:
If your friend had an accepted claim with AirHelp but you didn't receive your reward, check if your friend used the correct link or QR code. They have to use your unique link or code for us to confirm your reward.
If it's correct and you still haven't received anything, email us at <externalLink>helpafriend@airhelp.com</externalLink>.

friendsSection.description: Every month, thousands of air passengers are affected by flight delays and cancellations — your friends included. Help by telling them about AirHelp, and you'll get a <reward>{{value}} reward</reward> for each successful compensation claim they make.
friendsSection.title: Chances are your friends have suffered a flight delay

reward.description: Receive a reward every time a friend gets compensated.

items: You share your link or let other person to scan your QR code.
They file a claim for flight compensation.
If their claim's successful, we'll email you a {{value}} gift card. It's that simple.

reward.title: Get a <reward>{{value}}</reward> gift card for each successful claim.
